content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple puzzle. Math terminology is well explained.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is a great puzzle that puts your mind to work

great puzzle, bit hard to understand the meaning at first but in the end i got it, i had an issue with some of the test cases where i had to specify that if the base angle was more than 360* and was an multiple of 360 that i had to subtract 1 from the total number, and also if the base angle started negative i also had to subtract 1 from the total number, i believe this is due to my lack of coding experience since the test data outputs match up with the actual result.  Overall great puzzle and i will approve it

The sentence "An angle is coterminal with D if you can add or subtract 360° from it any number of times" doesn't explain what you mean (you can _always_ add or subtract 360 from any number).
I'd suggest instead something like: "two angles are coterminal if their difference is a multiple of 360°".
Once fixed, I'd approve it.

Goal
* Please format all instances of the variable names D and N as [[variables]].

Input
* Please format all instances of the variable names D and N as [[variables]].

* Please format "Line 1", "Line 2" and "Next [[N]] lines" in <<bold>>.

Output
* Please format "D" as a [[variable]].

Constraints
* Please format "D" and "N" as [[variables]].

* Please change the lower limit of N to 1.

Cases
* Currently half of the cases require an output of 4. Please vary the cases a bit to require a wider range of answers.

* Additionally, include some some test angles of less than -999 degrees (e.g. -1000, -2647, -3600) in **both** tests and validators. This may be done as part of the test case adjustments mentioned above.

Thanks.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Just add <<>> for bold and [[]] for variables. Good idea, be a bit more clearer
